lexUnit.name: wail.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: manifest or feel deep sorrow for; lament.

sentence.text: ` I do n't want to walk , " he wailed .
` I do n't know what to do , " Louise wailed .
And if the shouting were n't bad enough , all of a sudden the mice began wailing : ` The brute is loose !
` Mum , I really do n't want to go to school today , " he wailed .
` What 's going on here ? " she wailed .
" It 's so bad for her teeth , " Maman wailed .
` I shall be ruined , beheaded , disbarred from the Buffaloes , " he wailed .
` And a few hours later , he did , " she wailed .
` Oh will you go away ? " she wailed irritably .
“ But why ? ” she wailed .
` His eyes are weepy , " she wailed .
` It simply has to go , " wails Hutchinson .
` My mum does n't love me , " wailed Chico .
` It 's not my fault , " wailed Felix , as Mr Patel struck him a blow to the shin .
They both enthused over my new look and I became weepy and wailed that I could n't keep them .
I just put the title ` Division " on the board and they immediately wail that they ca n't do it .
` I can only weep and wail that my years of workless wandering have left me no riches to offer this holy infant !
But then the second girl wails that she has laughed away her whizz powder .
Ziba wailed her grief .
I just heard Fagg shouting , ` How dare you , sir ? " and the Commander wailing something about old times .
The woman reporter almost wailed the words .
` But what about Christmas ? " wailed the little 'un .
` He was killed ! " wailed the support group .
“ The château 's at the very top of the hill , ” she wailed to herself .
` If she 'd been herself , " Maisie wailed to Robert , ` she 'd have looked . "
She had n't gone far when she heard Nick wailing behind her , ‘ Carrie , wait for me , wait … ’
It ca n't be , she wanted to wail aloud , it just ca n't be !
This is my case , " he almost wailed .
` And would n't you think just one person would be glad to help me ? " she wailed when Ellie asked what on earth was the matter .
